documentation.content:
## Example: Comparing Logger Levels

```Elixir
iex> Logger.compare_levels(:debug, :warning)
:lt
iex> Logger.compare_levels(:error, :info)
:gt
```

## Example: Logging Critical Messages

```Elixir
Logger.critical("this is a critical message")

# as keyword list
Logger.critical([something: :reported, this: :critical])

# as map
Logger.critical(%{this: :critical, something: :reported})

# as a keyword list
Logger.critical("this is a critical message", [user_id: 42, request_id: "xU32kFa"])

# as map
Logger.critical("this is a critical message", %{user_id: 42, request_id: "xU32kFa"})
```

## APIDOC: Elixir Logger.Formatter.pattern() Type Definition

```APIDOC
@type pattern() :: :date | :level | :levelpad | :message | :metadata | :node | :time
```

## Elixir Logger: Log Warning Message (Deprecated)

```APIDOC
Function: warn(message_or_fun, metadata \ [])
  Description: This macro is deprecated. Use Logger.warning/2 instead.
```

## Elixir Logger: Log Notice Messages

```Elixir
Logger.notice("this is a notice message")
```

## Elixir Logger: Log Notice Messages

```Elixir
# as keyword list
Logger.notice([something: :reported, this: :notice])
```

## Elixir Logger: Log Notice Messages

```Elixir
# as map
Logger.notice(%{this: :notice, something: :reported})
```

## Elixir Logger: Log Notice Messages

```Elixir
# as a keyword list
Logger.notice("this is a notice message", [user_id: 42, request_id: "xU32kFa"])
```

## Elixir Logger: Log Notice Messages

```Elixir
# as map
Logger.notice("this is a notice message", %{user_id: 42, request_id: "xU32kFa"})
```

## Elixir Logger: Compile-time Purge by Application and Function

```Elixir
config :logger,
  compile_time_purge_matching: [
    [application: :foo],
    [module: Bar, function: "foo/3", level_lower_than: :error]
  ]
```

## Elixir Logger: Set Application Logging Level

```APIDOC
Function: put_application_level(appname, level)
  Signature: @spec put_application_level(atom(), level() | :all | :none) :: :ok | {:error, :not_loaded}
  Description: Puts logging level for modules in a given application. This will take priority over the primary level set, so it can be used to increase or decrease verbosity of some parts of the project.
```

## Elixir Logger: Set Application Logging Level

```Elixir
appname |> Application.spec(:modules) |> Logger.put_module_level(level)
```

## Example: Deleting Application Log Level

```Elixir
appname |> Application.spec(:modules) |> Logger.delete_module_level()
```

## Elixir Logger: Log Warning Messages

```Elixir
Logger.warning("this is a warning message")
```

## Elixir Logger: Log Warning Messages

```Elixir
# as keyword list
Logger.warning([something: :reported, this: :warning])
```

## Elixir Logger: Log Warning Messages

```Elixir
# as map
Logger.warning(%{this: :warning, something: :reported})
```

## Elixir Logger: Log Warning Messages

```Elixir
# as a keyword list
Logger.warning("this is a warning message", [user_id: 42, request_id: "xU32kFa"])
```

## Elixir Logger: Log Warning Messages

```Elixir
# as map
Logger.warning("this is a warning message", %{user_id: 42, request_id: "xU32kFa"})
```

## Type Definition: pattern()

```APIDOC
@type pattern() :: :date | :level | :levelpad | :message | :metadata | :node | :time
```
